skill.name: tech-stack-evaluator
skill.description: Comprehensive technology stack evaluation and comparison tool with TCO analysis, security assessment, and intelligent recommendations for engineering teams
skill.summary: Comprehensive technology stack evaluation and comparison tool with TCO analysis, security assessment...
skill.author: alirezarezvani

security_audit.summary: All 190 static findings are false positives. The skill is a legitimate technology evaluation tool. Flags were triggered by security/compliance documentation keywords, bash command examples in markdown, and URL references - not malicious code patterns.

content.user_title: Evaluate technology stacks for informed decisions
content.value_statement: Engineering teams need data-driven insights when comparing technologies. This skill provides comprehensive evaluation including cost analysis, security assessment, and migration planning.
actual_capabilities: Compare technologies with weighted scoring matrices
Calculate total cost of ownership over 3-5 years
Assess security posture and compliance readiness
Analyze ecosystem health and long-term viability
Compare cloud providers for specific workloads
limitations: Does not execute code or access live systems
TCO calculations are estimates based on provided data
Cannot account for organizational or political factors

use_cases.title: Technology selection decisions
use_cases.description: Compare frameworks and tools with data-driven recommendations and confidence scores.

use_cases.title: Stack migration planning
use_cases.description: Assess migration complexity, estimate effort, and identify risks before committing.

use_cases.title: Cloud provider comparison
use_cases.description: Compare AWS, Azure, GCP for specific workloads with cost and feature analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Quick comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare React vs Vue for a SaaS dashboard application

prompt_templates.title: Stack evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate this stack for real-time collaboration: Next.js, Node.js, PostgreSQL, WebSockets, AWS

prompt_templates.title: Cost analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Calculate 5-year TCO for migrating to AWS vs Azure with 20 servers, 5TB storage

prompt_templates.title: Migration assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Assess migration from Angular.js to React for a 75,000 line codebase with 300 components

output_examples.input: Compare PostgreSQL vs MongoDB for a SaaS application
output: Key strengths: ACID compliance, enterprise support, strong ecosystem
Key concerns: MongoDB offers more flexibility for unstructured data

output_examples.input: Analyze security of Express.js + MongoDB stack for SOC2
output: Missing features: audit logging, encryption at rest
Recommendation: Implement missing features before audit

best_practices: Provide complete context including team size, timeline, and constraints
Use weighted priorities to reflect your specific needs
Request comprehensive reports for major decisions
Validate recommendations against your specific requirements
anti_patterns: Using for trivial decisions between nearly identical tools
Ignoring team skill assessment in recommendations
Making emergency production decisions without validation
Relying solely on recommendations without business review

faq.question: Does this skill access external systems?
faq.answer: No. The skill performs analysis on provided data without making network calls or accessing external services.

faq.question: How accurate are the security assessments?
faq.answer: Security scores are based on provided vulnerability data and compliance requirements. Users should verify with official sources.

faq.question: Can I export reports?
faq.answer: Yes. The report generator can export comprehensive evaluation reports to markdown files.

faq.question: What input formats are supported?
faq.answer: Text, JSON, YAML, and URLs are automatically detected and parsed.

faq.question: Does this skill execute code?
faq.answer: No. The skill only performs analysis and generates recommendations without executing user code.

faq.question: How is confidence calculated?
faq.answer: Confidence scores are based on data completeness, score gaps between options, and analysis scope.
